title: You know, if you're going to adjust Morgana's passive to make her more interactive...
body: Then also change Nasus's. There's no excuse for letting him lifesteal off of minions after a trade and come back up to full health without interacting with champions. Change lifesteal for ADCs to that same window as well.

replies.body: Nasus can't do it from safe range, he has to actually walk up to the minions, which leaves him open to harass. It's just that people pick farming champions into Nasus, which works perfectly fine for him, because they can't harass well.

Exactly.

Old Morg could drop her W on a minion wave and back off, killing the entire wave, and healing for a chunk of health from 1000 units away.

Nasus has to be inside the minion wave if he ever wants to heal.

On top of all of that, Juggernauts need sustain. Without it they would be absolutely shit tier. that isnt the case for mages.

she needs lv3+ W to kill caster minions.
she also needs those caster minions to stay put for a duration while she clears it.

this means: you can kill the minions your casters/melees are focusing, in order to make them move and avoid morgana being able to clear the wave ;)
see, there's counterplay to her wave clear, you just have to be creative

also, her heal wasn't major off minions, it was there, but not anything insane.
I don't see how people complain, morgana lost her spellvamp and got a 300% stronger heal..... for team fights....... like seriously, how can you complain. She also has a safe laning phase, so, that small extra heal lost isn't a big deal

This isnt about wave clear, its about sustain.

She doesnt need to kill the wave to get the sustain from her.

Im not even remotely complaining. Im saying that Morg's old wave of sustaining was uninteractive, but Nasus's current way of sustaining is interactive.

her old wave sustaining was 33% of the damage dealt, due to spell vamp, and because she uses her W, that's an opening for you to engage on her. And yes, it was possible. 
For example, Ahri, Katarina and Akali could all engage on morgana after she Wed a wave. Especially post 6. And pre 6, only at lv5 she could easily clear casters. And that is only if you didn't try to counterplay it by attacking the minions your caster minions are attacking to force your caster minions to move out of her W.

She did have a less interactive laning phase than, lets say Lux or Zed.
But is that really a bad thing?
Like honestly. Its not like Morri was a hyper late game carry.
And if she plays super passively, you could just hard wave push and then roam. She would need at least 2 Ws to clear minion waves, and that would take like 10-20 seconds.

I feel like you people don't realize that some of us like the "non interactive" laning phase and focus more on team fights. And 'non interactive lane' means you can't really kill your enemy in a 1v1. But you can still do that in a 2v1, or you can still roam to your other lanes.
Mid being the lane from where people roam the most, so, ummm, again. I don't see a problem with 'non interactive' laning phase.

If I were to choose between laning against a morgana and laning vs an oppressive champion like azir. I would pick to go against morgana any day. Even if i were akali, kata, ahri or ....ok, i don't know other mid laners anymore, but still.

Passive/non interactive laning >>> much better than oppressive laning phase.

There's counterplay vs morg but it's a lot harder when you're melee.

Nasus is a melee so it's easier to harass him.

The exception to this is E max Nasus/Quasi Nasus/AP Nasus variants, which Riot has been trying to get of. Those basically do the same thing Morg does in-lane when she spams her tormented soil

i agree with your first two statements. 
But I don't see how riot is trying to get rid of ap/max E nasus. I think it still works just fine doing that (usually in aram), but i might be wrong

ARAM has mana regen and everyone confined in tight spaces.

The Doran's nerf unintentionally hurt Quasi Nasus because Quasi Nasus would stack Doran's early to harass the enemy laner constantly while not going OOM. 

Riot keeps pushing for Nasus to be using the circle from his E to be used as an ideal spot for fighting rather than just a poke tool.

To make it so the E max build is generally less appealing than Q, they made several buffs to it. While these changes were meant to make Nasus more impactful overall in the game, they indirectly dissuade players from maxing E, as Q is much more effective.
That would kind of gut him in a lot of matchups. Im not sure what they should do to him, but I don't think getting rid of the only thing keeping him alive in the early game would be a great idea

It wouldn't get rid of it. It would be nudged down a bit.

Edit: Dunno why I'm getting downvoted. I guess rabid mains are coming out in force because they want to keep an unfair mechanic.

Because you don't completely understand the outcome of OP's Nasus change to be calling it "nudged".

{{champion:25}}  passive wasnt "changed" it was straight up gutted
it is EXACTLY the same is it was (20% healing) but it not instead of affecting everyone it only heals off of champions, lartge jungle camps, and cannon minions.

for somthing that is supposed to "help her"  she bascially cant splitpush anymore (because she cant heal off the waves)
and the also lowered her max hp by about 200

and considering she NEEDS to be tanky  survive getting her ulti off. gutting her heal AND her hp basically means she went from a balanced champ to a trash champ.

the fact that riot even said "they are doing this to try to make her mid lane viable" is enough proof in and of itself that this change was a lie.

ANY morgana main could tell you she has ALWAYS been FINE in mid lane if not downright opressive mid lane...
she is just MORE FUN to play as support. she is actaully quite toxic to face mid lane. and no only she can already mid lane.. trying to put her back in mid lane would her kit WAY too toxic.
it is a horrible idea all around
Morgana has never in her life been an optimal splitpusher. If you're taking a utility mage with conditional damage and trying to split push with her youve been playing her wrong.

> [{quoted}](name=Attticus Finch,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MaLgVdWT,comment-id=000d0000,timestamp=2017-12-17T03:30:39.861+0000)

she is about the move optimal splitpusher you can ever get out of a support
as she requires two people to stop her,

if its just one she can escape with her Q the speed boost and/or active from {{item:3092}}  and  and her sheild to stop CC.

or she can flat out 1v1 the person trying to stop her.. which i have done on many occasions

she may not be the level of an ACTUAL splitpusher like {{champion:75}}  or {{champion:23}}.
but as a support she _does_ did the as good as you could ever hope for.

i mean if you are the enemy team.. and you have to send TWO people to stop the SUPPORT from splitpushing.
call it what u want... i find that a pretty damn effective use.

and and we are talking high silver/gold  maybe LOW plat here on occation, it's not like my team is taking the CS like they should be anyways...

Marksmen getting changed in that way would completely destroy lifesteal as a stat.    
Many marksmen wouldn't even utilize it as when a fight happens, you don't have a health pool large enough to use it so you're putting all your luck into crits and AS, which you don't have enough in the early to mid game anyway. And when the late game comes, it's all about burst at that point so lifesteal doesn't matter as you either blow a target up or they blow you up.

So any Marksman who uses lifesteal from AS would take a seat on a bench in favor of Marksmen who are predominantly casters or long(er) range champions.

Lifesteal+crit+burst per second = draintanks based on the "i clicked first" principle.
Yes remove nasus's lifesteal and watch him struggle even harder against ranged top laners.

This would destroy nasus in lane. His lifesteal is the only thing that saves him from having to back every 2 minutes. When people see a Nasus they instantly take advantage and go super aggro to poke him out of lane. If he couldn't sustain then he simply wouldn't be able to lane.

Yeah, that goes for every champion. And you're completely missing the point. I didn't say "take off the lifesteal". You made that faulty assumption yourself. I said "change the windows of opportunity for him to lifesteal". Darius has to hit an ability on a champion to get healing in lane outside of pots. Illaoi has to hit people with her tentacles to get healing outside of pots. Nasus gets to hit a minion for health without interacting with enemy champions. Something there has to change.

Illaoi has to hit people with her tentacles to get healing outside of pots. Nasus gets to hit a minion for health without interacting with enemy champions. Something there has to change.

There's no way to change the windows of opportunity for him to lifesteal. It's not like he's actively fighting his laner in lane, he's stacking. I don't see any real way to tone down his lifesteal without completely ruining his laning phase, which is already very weak as is.

If his stacking mechanic is what forces him into a passive playstyle, then change that. 

My main gripe is that while Riot has stated that Morgana's passive allowed her to be uninteractive, they have done little to abate the issue of ADCs (and, by association, Nasus) healing up off of minions after a trade. They shouldn't be two-faced about this. If one mechanic is problematic, then they need to address the other, related mechanics.

Alright, I'm gonna respond to this seriously, despite the sassiness. It's all about feel. Morgana's spell vamp was adjusted because she was healing up from trades while being uninteractive. She'd drop W and then walk away. Nasus only has to hit minions, and if he's pushed under tower, it makes it easier unless he's against range. Any unfavourable trade he takes can be mitigated by the fact that he can continue to ignore the enemy laner for as long as he desires.

"It's all about feel. "

No, it really isnt. This isnt your Tumblr lol

Comparing siphoning strike to tainted ground is a false equivelence. The former is practically a melee ability which leaves Nasus open to all kinds of punishment, the latter can be cast from half a lane away and leaves little to no window for punishment even against other mages. Its objectively not the same thing at all.

Imo All vamp effects should have limited power vs minions, and therefor the reduction for aoe should be removed or atleast changed.
They should honestly merge Nasus healing into his Q, Like have him heal for half stack amount or something and give him a real passive.

I too want to see what they decide to do with the data from the Morgana vamp changes.
Should be an exciting year for counterplay (hopefully).
Nasus' life stealing off minions after a trade is literally the only thing that makes him able to lane... you take that out and you'll see his win rate drop harder than nunu's.

So then rework him to the point where he's not forced into an uninteractive playstyle to even remotely be allowed into lane. If him lifestealing off of minions is the do-or-die point of his kit, then he needs to be looked at.

Why? 0.o

Its his thing, and it doesnt make him overly strong or overly weak. It forces you to if you're laning against him to not screw up your wave management and allow him to free farm under tower. Not every champion needs to have to fight and trade often in lane.

The lifesteal issue with ADCs early in lane isnt that big of a problem in my opinion (it does become an issue mid/late game I believe). This is because both ADCs are doing it. On top of them both life stealing, sometimes they even have a support that offers sustain, but the other one can have it too.

For Morgs case, not both mid laners have some kind of excessive sustain mechanic. When I take Morgana mid, I relye upon sustain to help keep my opponet disinterested in attacking me. The changes just make that sustain something my oponent can see coming and try to work around.

In Nasus case, he is able to be shut down hard by a handful of champions, and his sustain puts him in a position to be strong against other champions. So there is an excuse for letting him lifesteal off of minions. Hes immobile, has one CC ability, and has to farm (limited by the cooldown of an ability) to have a mid game threat. If he couldnt keep his HP topped off he wouldnt have much of a laning phase.
